newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Costello sees easier rate pressure.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Costello sees easier rate pressure.

text.p: Australian Treasurer Peter Costello said on Monday that the economy was experiencing easier pressure on interest rates.

"As far as the government is concerned, with our determined efforts to put in place a budget against the sabotage of the opposition, with the easing of pressures in relation to interest rates, the forecast investment for 1996/97 is welcome," Costello told parliament.
It was not clear whether Costello was referring to easier pressure on interest rates from demand and inflation in the economy, or from interest rates onto business investment decisions.
The Reserve Bank has twice reduced official interest rates this year, with official cash now set at 6.5 percent.

The conservative Liberal-National government forecast 14 percent year average growth in business investment for the fiscal year to June 1997. Recent quarterly capital expenditure data indicated that this forecast could be easily achieved.
